title: Police investigating Burlington shooting
content:
BURLINGTON-- A 17-year-old boy from Moorestown was shot in the leg Thursday night, police said.
A reserve officer was monitoring security cameras shortly before 7 p.m. when he saw what appeared to be a fight among several people in the 500 block of York Street. Officers nearby were conducting a motor-vehicle stop when they heard shots fired as more police were headed to the area.
Police found the victim, who was taken to Cooper Medical Center in Camden, where he is listed in stable condition. No arrests have been made.
"The City of Burlington Police Department will not rest until the people responsible for these crimes are brought to justice," said Chief Alan R. Snow. "In order to do that, we need the cooperation from our residents who witness these heinous acts to speak to our detectives before another tragedy strikes."
Anyone with information is being asked to call Det. Anna Czajka 609-386-0262, ext. 221. Confidential tips can also be sent via a message to the department's Facebook page.
